Class MainMenu2

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • MainMenu2

  • public class MainMenu2
extends javafx.application.Application
    The MainMenu2 class extends the JavaFX Application Class, and is used for the Main Menu launcher for the game. It serves as the basic stepping stone for the user to start any level they want (essentially like a control panel).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  MainMenu2.ButtonHandler

      GridHandler for detecting user's mouse movements and displaying them on the main menu.
      (package private) class  MainMenu2.KeyboardListener
      KeyboardListener for detecting user's key movements and displaying them on the main menu.

      • openNewStage

        private void openNewStage(javafx.stage.Stage old)
        Opens the Stage (in the case that the developer wishes to include the beginning animation). If not, it simply acts as the start() method. In this method, all components of the stage are loaded and displayed for the user to see in the MainMenu. Listeners and Handlers are defined outside of this method for the most part. All components of the stage are inside of a BorderPane, with inner BorderPanes, GridPanes, VBoxes, HBoxes, and more being used for displaying inner components.
        Parameters:
        old - reference to the old Stage (if there was an opening animation).

      • initAbout

        private void initAbout(javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane about)
